<html><body><div><div class="article-body | article w-100"><p class="text | article-text">LEXINGTON, Neb. (KOLN) - Nebraska State Patrol troopers have arrested a Colorado man after locating 116 pounds of marijuana processing material during a traffic stop on Interstate 80 in Dawson County.</p><p class="text | article-text">On Sunday around 2:30 p.m., a trooper observed a westbound vehicle speeding on I-80 near mile marker 238. During the traffic stop, the trooper detected a marijuana odor coming from the vehicle, officials said.</p><p class="text | article-text">A search of the vehicle revealed approximately 116 pounds of marijuana resin, wax and vape, according to NSP. Troopers also located items for processing marijuana into smaller portions, NSP said.</p><p class="text | article-text">The driver, Dylan Worrall, 24, of Colorado, was arrested for possession of over one pound of marijuana, possession of drug paraphernalia and no drug tax stamp. He was booked into Dawson County Jail.</p><p class="w-100"></p><figure class="media-item | figure media-item-image article-image w-100"><figcaption class="figure-caption mt-1 px-1"><span class="caption-text">Dylan Worrall mugshot</span><span class="caption-credit">(Dawson County Sheriff's Office)</span></figcaption></figure><p class="text | article-text">The Dawson County Sheriffâ€™s Office also assisted in the search.</p><p class="text | article-text"><a href="https://www.1011now.com/newsletter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><i>Click here</i></a><i> to subscribe to our 10/11 NOW daily digest and breaking news alerts delivered straight to your email inbox.</i></p><p class="copyright |"><i>Copyright 2026 KOLN. All rights reserved.</i></p></div></div></body></html>
